meanings.definition: To make or become twice as much or as many
meanings.sent1: She doubled the number of candies by adding more.
meanings.sent2: The baker doubled the recipe to make more cookies.
meanings.sent3: The magician doubled the number of rabbits in his hat!
meanings.sent4: Her happiness doubled when she saw her best friend.
meanings.sent5: The excitement in the room doubled as the party started.

meanings.definition: To bend or fold back on itself
meanings.sent1: He doubled the paper to create a neat crease.
meanings.sent2: The tailor doubled the fabric before sewing.
meanings.sent3: The map doubled in half, making it easier to carry.
meanings.sent4: The road doubled back on itself, confusing the travelers.
meanings.sent5: She doubled the ribbon to make a beautiful bow.

meanings.definition: To increase by adding an equal amount
meanings.sent1: They doubled their savings by depositing more money.
meanings.sent2: The team doubled their efforts to win the game.
meanings.sent3: The laughter doubled when the joke was retold.
meanings.sent4: His determination doubled as he neared the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The flowers doubled in beauty with each passing day.
